message: I really just want to know why Chris felt it necessary to comment on a post about two men getting married, just to basically tell them he does not approve (or Jesus or Satan or God doesn't approve, I dunno anymore). Why couldn't you have just seen this, said something to yourself, and moved on? What possessed you to make your initial post in the first place? Do you think after this couple reads it, they are going to quickly discover religion, get a divorce, and forever change their ways? What was your purpose for getting involved in the first place?

A 2700 year old papyrus mentioning Jerusalem written in paleo-Hebrew is as much a treasure of Palestinian history as it is of Jewish history, as it is of world history. Propping it up as a exclusively Jewish artifact because it's in Hebrew (as if Palestinian history can't include the Jewish history of Palestine) is as absurd as the denigration of Arabic as a non-Jewish language, when in fact some of the great works of Jewish philosophy and poetry are in Arabic. To draw nationalist, sectarian lines around complex, multifaceted cultural products ignores the deep connections of all peoples in the region.

I travelled to Europe 10 times between 2001-2007, and George Bush was considered a Nazi, much like his father and grandfather. I see no evidence of the Constitution being shredded for Shiria Law. Sharia Law is not very common in the Muslim World, much less in America. That would be like saying, """"America Lynches Black folks"""" based on looking at the Klan in the segregation days. Your whole construct is based on fallacy, therefore you are an Idiot.
